page.title: 04BERKELEY VALE DAIRY FARMING
page.content: {Dairy farming}around Berkeley Power Station was very wide spread in the past, but in the spring of 1983 the {quota}system was brought in allowing the farmer to produce only a certain amount of{milk.}The amount that he could produce was based on his previous years production. If the year before was a particularly bad year for the farmer then he had to just accept the terms. This did in fact mean that many of the local farmers had to {reduce}the size of their herds. Were the quotas realy needed? We were not producing enough milk for our own use, it was just that milk production in{Europe}was too high. In fact we import milk to make up the reqiured amounts for this country. Increased costs of{feed concentrates have also meant farmers have had to cut back
